properties.abstract: Describes how to use the Ant task for the Castor XML Code Generator and what is currently supported.

body.title: Using the Ant task for the Castor XML Code Generator

header.p: API Reference: The Source Builder API

section.title: Castor source generator Ant task
section.p: An alternative to using the command line as shown in the previous section, the Castor Source Generator Ant Task can be used to call the source generator for class generation. The only requirement is that the castor-<version>-codegen-antask.jar must be on the CLASSPATH.

section.title: Specifying the source for generation
section.p: As shown in the subsequent table, there's multiple ways of specifying the input for the Castor code generator. At least one input source has to be specified.

crow.td: The XML schema, to be used as input for the source code generator.
No.
Sets a directory such that all XML schemas in this directory will have code generated for them.
No
URL to an XML schema, to be used as input for the source code generator.
No.

section.p: In addition, a nested <fileset> can be specified as the source of input. Please refer to the samples shown below.

section.title: Parameters
section.p: Please find below the complete list of parameters that can be set on the Castor source generator to fine-tune the execution behavior.

section.title: Using a file
section.p: Below is an example of how to use this task from within an Ant target definition named 'castor:gen:src':
section.code-panel:
<target name="castor:gen:src" depends="init" description="Generate Java source files from XSD.">
<taskdef name="castor-srcgen" classname="org.castor.anttask.CastorCodeGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="generated" /> <castor-srcgen file="src/schema/sample.xsd" todir="generated-source" package="org.castor.example.schema" types="j2" warnings="true" /> </target>

section.title: Using an URL
section.p: Below is the same sample as above, this time using the url attribute as the source of input instead:
section.code-panel:
<target name="castor:gen:src" depends="init" description="Generate Java source files from XSD.">
<taskdef name="castor-srcgen" classname="org.castor.anttask.CastorCodeGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="generated" /> <castor-srcgen schemaURL="http://some.domain/some/path/sample.xsd" todir="generated-source" package="org.castor.example.schema" types="j2" warnings="true" /> </target>

section.title: Using a nested <fileset>
section.p: Below is the same sample as above, this time using the url attribute as the source of input instead:
section.code-panel:
<target name="castor:gen:src" depends="init" description="Generate Java source files from XSD.">
<taskdef name="castor-srcgen" classname="org.castor.anttask.CastorCodeGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="generated" /> <castor-srcgen todir="generated-source" package="org.castor.example.schema" types="j2" warnings="true" > <fileset dir="${basedir}/src/schema"> <include name="**/*.xsd"/> </fileset> </castor-srcgen> </target>
